description: failed to identify the hazard of working in close proximity to a glass atrium and lightwells, through which persons could fall a distance of approximately 13.4 meters to the basement floor below, failed to ensure that suitable and sufficient measures such as protective coverings were in place to prevent persons falling, and failed to ensure that the work was appropriately supervised, and as a result the work at height was not carried out in manner which was, so far as is reasonably practicable, safe, thereby exposing operatives to a risk of falls from height, resulting in an employee falling a distance through the glass atrium causing serious personal injury.
